title: New Masteries = Rip Supports?
body: With the new patch 5.2.2 coming out, Riot has reworked the masteries. I am curious as to why these masteries no longer give supports an option for bonus exp while near a champion of higher exp. Supports who roam, or go to ward miss out on exp, and most supports do not go solo farming for levels. I am just wondering what other people that play support think about the mastery changes as without the bonus exp, I am finding it hard to get into the mid/late game without getting extremely under-levelled.

replies.body:
Well if you're roaming, then you aren't earning that exp are you? Since you needed a champion near you to provide the (minimal) exp it defeats the purpose of why you took them. I actually think that problem is that while cutting back the actual choices, there are too many possible load-outs for different champions that I think that maybe expanding on the 20 page cap wouldn't hurt...

But yeah, just experiment with them. Right now, I'm trying the "Bonds of Stone" mastery with Braum and my other tanky supports.

> With the new patch 5.2.2 coming out, Riot has reworked the masteries. I am curious as to why these masteries no longer give supports an option for bonus exp while near a champion of higher exp. Supports who roam, or go to ward miss out on exp, and most supports do not go solo farming for levels. I am just wondering what other people that play support think about the mastery changes as without the bonus exp, I am finding it hard to get into the mid/late game without getting extremely under-levelled.

Definitely not a mastery I will miss.

As a support main, I didn't really think this was a significant amount of the experience that I earned during a match - especially because the main reason I'd want to take an increased experience mastery would be to help me catch back up due to missing experience while roaming.... The main problem being that during the time I'm moving between lanes, there's champion near me to give that experience! 

In more seriousness, the amount of exp was relatively small if you actually roamed a lot - which was generally my style of play in S2015/S4.  I actually think a bunch of other changes in the game - gold generation over time, other new masteries, shutdown gold becoming global, less other roles buying wards, and some really sweet tank-masteries will probably increase support's relative power this season.
